column5: In `ferri-core/src/flow.rs`, rename the `Pipeline` struct to `Flow`.
In `ferri-core/src/flow.rs`, rename the `Step` struct to `Job`.
In `ferri-core/src/flow.rs`, rename the `steps` field in the `Flow` struct to `jobs`.
Update `serde` field attributes to expect `jobs` in the YAML file instead of `steps`.
Refactor all function names and variables in the `flow` module to use "job" instead of "step" (e.g., `run_pipeline` -> `run_flow`).
Update `pm/gemini_code_review.yml` and any other flow files to use the new `jobs` syntax.
Update `qa/gemini_code_review_walkthrough.md` to reflect the new `jobs` syntax.
Globally search the codebase for any remaining user-facing instances of "step" and replace with "job" for consistency.
In `ferri-core/src/flow.rs`, add an optional `dependencies: Vec<String>` field to the `Job` struct.
In the `run_flow` function, implement a dependency resolution algorithm (e.g., topological sort) to determine the correct execution order.
The dependency resolution logic must be able to handle parallel execution for jobs that have no dependencies on each other.
In the `run_flow` function, add robust error handling for missing or circular dependencies.
Create a new `pm/dependency_test_flow.yml` file with a non-linear job structure to serve as a test case.
In `ferri-cli/tests/flow.rs`, add a new integration test that runs the `dependency_test_flow.yml` and verifies jobs run in the correct order.
Audit every command and flag in `README.md` against the current implementation in `ferri-cli/src/main.rs`.
Rewrite the `ferri flow` section in `README.md` to accurately describe the new `jobs` and `dependencies` syntax.
Add a clear, complex example of a flow with dependencies in `README.md`.
Create a new `CONTRIBUTING.md` file outlining the project structure, development workflow, and coding conventions.
Review and update `COMMAND_MODIFIERS.md` to ensure all listed modifiers are implemented and correctly described.
Add a "Project Status" section to the `README.md` that explicitly states the tool is in active development and documentation may lag.
